forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 12 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers before 7pm, then rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 49. West wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The air is tinged with the scent of impending rain as Downtown San Francisco prepares for a day where the clouds reign supreme. A veil of gray spreads across the sky, gathering strength for showers that will dance on the pavement later this afternoon. Even now, gusts stir the atmosphere, swirling with that familiar bite of the west-southwest wind. The temperature hovers in a cool embrace, offering a gentle reminder of the season, with a promise that as the day unfolds, the mercury will dip just enough for a thick sweater to offer comfort.

As fog drapes lazily over the edges of the Golden Gate, the horizon remains discernible, yet not entirely clear; the marine layer creeps inland, hinting at its presence but mostly holding back for now. In spite of the clouds, some might find joy in this muted light—ideal for a quiet stroll through the streets or perhaps a visit to a cozy café where the warmth of a hot drink complements the chill outside. Come evening, the expected rain will spill forth, so having an umbrella handy would be prudent while venturing out for a brief errand or a rendezvous with friends. Dress in layers; comfortable yet slightly rugged clothing will serve well to embrace the splendor of this atmospheric shift.
